page.title: 03Withy growing. Kingsbury.
page.content: Today,the 4th of June,we went to see some withies.We went to the moor with a withy grower.The withies we saw were twenty centimetres tall.They are grown on the moor because it is wetter there.They spray them once a week to kill aphids which lay their eggs in the top.They have to kill the aphids because they damage the tops and cause new shoots to grow at the bottom.This lessens the growth of the main shoot, which makes it no good for basket- making.Sometimes bugs bite into the leaves and galls appear.The galls are red and look like the blisters you get when you have pinched yourself.In August the withies stop growing and the leaves fall off.They do not cut them down until November.This gives them time to harden.They cut the withies with a cutter fixed behind a tractor.
